summary: The Anti-Racism in Public Health Act of 2025 aims to address racism's impact on public health. It establishes a National Center on Antiracism and Health within the CDC to conduct research, collect data, and develop interventions to dismantle structural racism. The bill also mandates a law enforcement violence prevention program within the CDC's National Center for Injury Prevention and Control to study and address the public health impacts of police violence, including data collection and research on interventions.
